etymologies: late 17th century. Apparently from classical Latin respondent-, respondēns, present participle of respondēre respond + -ia, probably reflecting the meaning ‘to make a return, give a yield’ shown by classical Latin respondēre

definitions: The system of lending money to the owner or master of a ship on the security of its cargo, the money being repaid (with maritime interest) only if the goods arrive safe at their destination.
